cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north across the west-central Gulf, then turning northeast toward the north-central Gulf Coast; expected to traverse inland across Louisiana and the lower Mississippi Valley.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal Cityâ€“Morgan City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, Louisiana, to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (peak 20-30 mph sustained, higher gusts) possible Saturday, diminishing by Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (port is inland on the Mississippi River; coastal surge limited to 2-3 ft along Louisiana coast).
weather_observation.rainfall: 4-8 inches with locally higher amounts; risk of flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Friday afternoon extending into Saturday.
